communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide the following information:

1. Any digital correspondence with key phrases "Virginia" "Virginia state flag" "frontal nudity" or "PebbleGo Next": (email, memos, direct messages) 
2. Any digital correspondence related to House Bill 900 (HB900): (emails, memos, direct messages)
3. Lamar Consolidated ISD's Policy EFB Local:  A copy of the policy before November 19, 2024 and after November 19, 2024. 
4. List of all prohibited or restricted PebbleGo/PebbleGo Next content. Include a comprehensive list of all articles or lessons "turned off" for each grade level. For each item on the list, include the exact name and specific reason for its restriction, as well as the date the access was changed. 

The date range for this request is: August 1, 2024 to date request is fulfilled.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Claire Woodcock

communications.subject: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Mark Middleton investigatory file
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Investigatory file on the death of Mark Middleton, who died of an apparent suicide on May 7, 2022 in Perry County, Arkansas. If any of the material is still deemed to be violative of Middleton's family's privacy interests (as it relates to photos, videos, sketches, or other illustrative content) please provide all non-violative materials from the investigatory file, such as written reports, memos, communications, or other materials which illustrate the investigatory findings.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sonny Albarado, a citizen of Arkansas, in coordination with Michael Tracey.
